item.description:
Alright, this is fairly new for me...have been in and around Boston for years now, and have yet to actually set foot in Symphony Hall. Realize this is a bit different from our typical adventures, but part of our credence is exploring new places and things and this definitely fits the bill for me.

Here's the description listed on the BSO website: http://www.bso.org/bs...

Folk and pop music are reinvented on the Pops stage in this special performance by the unmistakable original voice behind the band 10,000 Maniacs!

Featuring her lyrical vocals, this Pops presentation showcases Natalie Merchant's extraordinary solo career - the singing, songwriting, and producing expertise that has earned her the marks of a true musical innovator.

Natalie Merchant began her recording career as the lead vocalist and lyricist of the pop music band 10,000 Maniacs. Her voice and outspoken social awareness cemented her status as one of today?s most astute and captivating artists with a reputation as a songwriter and singer of quality.

EdgeFest Caf√©
After each EdgeFest concert, hear the best of today's emerging talent. The Everyday Visuals, a Boston-based indie-rock/folk band will perform after Natalie Merchant's Edgefest concerts on May 27 and 28 at Symphony Hall. Free to performance ticket holders. For more information about The Everyday Visuals, please visit their site at theeverydayvisuals.com.

Our block of tickets has been ordered, so you are on your own. But don't let that deter you! Check out the BSO link below, snag one for yourself and meet us for dinner!

We'll be meeting for a pre-concert dinner at Betty's Wok and Noodle diner between 5:45-6 p.m. If you cannot make dinner, let me know and we'll arrange to meet you before heading in (especially my block ticket folks...I have your ticket!!!). Plan to meet at 7:15 if you aren't heading to dinner!

Betty's website: http://bettyswokandno...

Will send out my cell number to my "yes" RSVP's so make sure your RSVP is accurate!

The doors open at 7, and the website requests we plan to be seated by 7:30 for the 8 pm performance. Dress is semi-formal/business attire. (heh, worry not, we'll be donning our tevas for events ASAP:-)

For directions, etc: check out the BSO link: http://www.bso.org/bs...

Feel free to email Lisa with questions!
item.name: Natalie Merchant sings with the Boston Pops
